metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10132 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in libvirt >= 4.1.0 in the virtlockd-admin.socket and virtlogd-admin.socket systemd units. A missing SocketMode configuration parameter allows any user on the host to connect using virtlockd-admin-sock or virtlogd-admin-sock and perform administrative tasks against the virtlockd and virtlogd daemons.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvirt-bin - 1.3.1-1ubuntu10.25
libvirt0 - 1.3.1-1ubuntu10.25
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.1-1ubuntu10.25').
